answers.answer: Relax.....too much stress on baby is a good thing. One hour gkucose tests are known to be wrong that is why they do a 3 hour. I failed the one hour with 2 pregnancies but passed the 3 houir. And if you do have gestational diabetes you have a great chance of having a normal healthy baby. You doctors will set you up with a nutritionist and as long as you follow all reccomendations you have a good prognosis. It is common for baby to be a little on the larger side but it does not mean baby is unhealthy. Dont get too stressed......make sure you follow the directions exactly for your next test. One of the biggest reasons the 1 hour is inaccurate is many moms eat or drink when they are not supposed to or the lab performs the test incorrectly. Good luck and congrats on your pregnancy!!

Only about 20percent of women who take the 1hr and have high sugars have gestational diabetes. I threw up the 3 hour drink so they tested my fasting blood and said I don't have gd. The 3 hour test is a process quite like the 1 hour. You first get your blood (fasting blood) before you drink the sugar glucose drink. After you drink it you will get your blood tested every hour for 3 hours. You're diagnosed if 2/3 (after fasting) or 3/4 including fasting (this is different depending on testing center) come back with high sugar levels. You can fix it with a diet. If the diet doesn't work you may be given insulin- but the diet usually works. Don't worry though:)

Every baby has the possibility of getting any problem related to gestational diabetes though. It's not your fault! When were getting bigger we don't have much stomach room which causes our body to not have a lot of room to break down our sugars which can cause high sugar levels in any pregnant woman. Even if you have gestational diabetes then don't worry because many people have had healthy babies with it!
